column4: how do I know what is using eth0 and what is using eth1?  I'm trying to set up firestarter and it's asking for both...
-> what do you meant by what is using eth0 ?
not sure.. but when I set both options to eth0 it says: "The local area and the Internet connected devices can not be the same."
so how do I know which is which?
-> are you reading any  tutorials at all on how to create a router?
no I just installed firestarter and I'm trying to run it
-> what exactly are you trying to acomplish?
I just want to run firestarter thats it.
-> to do what?  to protect one interface or two or three?
interface?
-> yes, nic card or so call network interface card
I don't know if I have any network interface cards
-> you have to have at least one to communicate, without it, you have an anchor on your desktop
I just connect to a linksys router which connects to the internet
I just want to know which one is eth0 and which one is eth1, "Internet connected device" and "local area device"
-> in a terminal  type      ifconfig   and it will tell you
ok I see eth0 and eth1 with a bunch of stuff after each, but I still don't know how to tell which is which...
-> may i suggest you read up some tutorials on networking?  pull the cat5 cable out and experiment, see what happens to the ifconfig  command results
why do I have to be an expert on this stuff just to run the firewall?
-> firewall stuff is for experts, you want it secured? you hire a professional okay?

I want to learn, but it just makes sense to me to at least be able to use the firewall while I learn about it.. i can't even use it until i get past this setup, and I can't do that until I figure out which is eth0 and which is eth1..  can't u just tell me?
-> i gave you a hint,  ifconfig  will tell you
